3: Speaking of which, you haven't said a thing so far. People won't even know you're here if you don't say something, Wanshi.
Where are the people? There's only the three of us here.
I know we're looking for them, but are we going to do that on foot? We're pretty far from the target location. Should we ask Babylonia to airdrop a vehicle? That'll get us there sooner.
Vehicles won't do well on these roads.
Why not? These roads are wide enough.
Wanshi quietly lifts a finger and points at the distance.

The others stop moving. For a moment, all they can hear is the swooshing wind, but soon the rumbling sound of waves comes loud and clear. A crimson red line emerges between the cement gray buildings and is quickly approaching.
That's ridiculous! It's at least three meters tall!
Well, we don't have to look for it anymore. Even though our mission priority has changed, we still have time to get a sample.
Yeah. Let's find a vantage point before the Red Tide gets here.
I have to say... that thing looks so... gross. I don't want to be anywhere near it.
According to Asimov's initial analysis, it's a combination of the Punishing Virus with certain 'impurities.'
Look at the concentration of Punishing Virus. I don't think anyone would dare to get close to it unless they're as special as Camu...
Why don't you ask Camu to check it out?
He accepted a mission as a freelancer, so we separated before I landed.
I wonder how he's doing now...
